Margins

< Previous Next >

Margins are used to create space around elements, outside of any defined borders

This element is surrounded by a margin of 70px

Margin - Individual Sides

CSS has properties for specifying the margin for each side element:

  • margin-top
  • margin-right
  • margin-bottom
  • margin-left

All the margin properties can have the following values

  • auto - the browser calculates the margin
  • length - specifies a margin in px, pt, cm, etc
  • % - specifies a margin in % of the width of the containing element
  • inherit - specifies that the margin should be inherited from the parent element

Tip: Negative values are allowed

Margin is set to a different px on each side

Margin shorthand

The following code gives a Margin of top, right, bottom, and left

p{
        margin: 25px 50px 75px 100px
    }

If the Margin has 3 values:

you get top 25px, right and left margin 50px and bottom margin 100px

p{
        margin: 25px 50px 100px
    }

If the Margin has 2 values:

You get top and bottom 25px with the right and left margin 100px

p{
        margin: 25px  100px
    }

If the Margin has 1 value:

All the sides have the same value

The auto value

You can set the margin property to auto to horizontally center the element in its container

The element will then take up the specified width, and the remaining space will be split between the right and left

The inherit Value

The shows how the left margin of the (p class="ex1") is inherited from the parent element ("div") with margin-left: inherit;

I am the child

Margin Collapse

Top and bottom margins of elements are sometimes collapsed into a single margin that is equal to the largest of the two margins.

This only happens on the top and bottom margins, not the left and right.

.top{
    margin: 0 0 50px 0;
    }
    
    .bottom{
    margin: 20px 0 0 0;
    }

The margin of 50px from .top and 20px from .bottom should give a margin of 70px but because of margin collaspse it stays at 50px due to 50px being the larger number. If this happened between the left and right sides the margin would be 70px.
